Directions
For the Marinade:
In a medium saucepan, place all marinade ingredients and whisk to combine. Cook over low heat stirring occasionally, until just warm and sugar is dissolved, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature, 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
In a 1-gallon zipper-lock bag, place chicken or pork cubes and pour marinade all over. Seal the bag, removing as much air as possible, and move meat until evenly coated. Refrigerate for 12 to 18 hours, turning bag and redistributing meat in marinade at least twice.
For a Charcoal Grill:
Open bottom vent completely. Light large chimney starter filled with charcoal briquettes (6 quarts). When top coals are partially covered with ash, pour evenly over half of grill. Set cooking grate in place, cover, and open lid vent completely. Heat grill until hot, about 5 minutes.
For a Charcoal Grill:
Open bottom vent completely. Light large chimney starter filled with charcoal briquettes (6 quarts). When top coals are partially covered with ash, pour evenly over half of grill. Set cooking grate in place, cover, and open lid vent completely. Heat grill until hot, about 5 minutes.
While grill is heating, thread meat onto skewers. Each piece of meat should touch the next, but do not push tightly together.
Working in batches if needed, grill, (covered for a gas grill) turning occasionally, until each side is nicely browned and the meat is cooked through, 6 to 10 minutes. Serve immediately.
Special Equipment
Medium saucepan, 1-gallon zipper-lock bag, charcoal grill or gas grill, grilling tongs, 14 (12-inch) metal or wooden skewers pre-soaked in water for at least 30 minutes
Notes
If using wooden skewers, soak skewers in water for at least 20 minutes before using.
